title: am i a bad person?
body:
Hey guys,
I just want to ask you if i am a bad person or not , for doing this.
So few days ago i played a game  in the jungle as Vi and my adc was super mad at the support he was flaming him , caling him names etc. I felt bad for the support actually. But i usually dont step in , i mute people that are flaming and report them after the game. I even have a story that a guy that i reported got banned and posted on the forums but anyway.
So me the adc and mid went for herald and i took it . The adc got mad at me cuz he wanted it for fast recalls. Start flaming me etc. So i decided instead of muting him and report him after the game ... to make him even more mad and get him 14days banned or perma banned. 
So i start talking with him, but i talked with him calmly , i was laughing , asking hows the weather in his country ( not flaming at all as most of the stories in this forum ) i was super chill. 
He got even more mad because he saw he cant make me mad. So he start using really bad words , racists words , instant 14 days ban words. So instead of stopping i decided to make him even more mad. He was so mad at one point that he stood on the spawn and kept spaming the 3 letter word that starts with K .... xD I reported him after the game and i got and feedback that he got punished . He havent played a game from few days , maybe he got banned 14 days or perma. 
I thought its right thing to do but right now im feeling kinda bad, i mean he might had a bad that thats why he was mad , but that doesnt give him a reason to be rude to his team. am i really a bad person for doing this?

replies.body:
In other words, he was deliberately manipulating him into punishment. It's not against the rules, but it is certainly morally corrupt.

Psychological manipulation is a type of social influence that aims to change the behavior or perception of others through indirect, deceptive, or underhanded tactics. By advancing the interests of the manipulator, often at another's expense, such methods could be considered exploitative and devious.

but this is not punished by riot so go for it, because its fun and the game should be fun no?
riot punishment system is perfect!!!
irony off
also we never know if the support wasnt permanently pushing and taking cs or the other extreme staying afk at tower all the time and in that way starve the adc.
there are tons of ways to troll the adc without getting banned by the system

The whole thing escalated at 4th minute when the adc lost a trade to enemy team and blamed the support for it. He was droppign death wishes to him at 4-5 minutes into the game. I didnt spoke until 17minutes when we killed herald and he start flaming me because i took it.
yes you are a bad person.  you made a bad situation even worse for your other 3 teammates and you purposely escalated something that may had settled if you'd just mute.
the other 3 people already jumped on him because he was hard flaming them too ^^ btw little edit we won that game somehow haha
it really does not matter, riot's punishment system is just bad, tbh I rather have a flamer who actually wants to win then a leaver/afk/ragequitter

A bad deed simply does not make you a bad person. Morality and life is a bit more complex than that. I dont know anything about you and anyone judging you as a whole based on one interaction, is foolish. No one can tell you if youre a bad person or not from this.

Yea heating someone up for no reason is pretty bad. If your mid was a duo then Id understand but this does generally fall into bad for most people, however I will not blame you for his ban, he had a choice to say those things, whether or not you fired him up. So, all in all, I think you're fine, but most people seem to disagree.

one encounter does not define a person as being "bad". Still, you definitely should've refrained from provoking the other person as you clearly influenced his punishment in a bias way. Although you may feel that you must DIRECTLY hold someone accountable for their actions through using your words, a report is enough. If they're getting mad, it clearly means the game means something to them, and a simple uninfluenced report should suffice.

Eh, if he doesn't have an ounce of self-control, it's not your problem. You probably taught him a thing or two about it. I don't have access to chat logs but if you responded to his flame by asking how the weather was at his place, then I got news for you folks, it's the oher guy's fault. Sure, the intent was wrong but that's equivalent of a person putting laxatives in a sandwich that always gets stolen by a coworker except this is even more minor. Sure, "purposefully allowing someone to fall for a trap you've laid for them" seems off but let's be honest folks, you're no different. Doesn't make it right, it just makes you hypocritical. I don't feel bad for that guy. Don't be like him. Don't flame your way into a 14-day/ permaban

All you did was use a effective method of punishing a player who was breaking the rules.

Don't feel bad, this guy deserves the punishment.
You are't a bad person. The guy got what he deserved, he had it coming. Provoking a toxic player even further isn't usually great if you're trying to win, however. But it sure does feel good.
